titlestmt.titleproper: A Finding Aid to the Jo Hanson Papers, circa 1969-2009, in the Archives of American Art AAA.hansjo
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Erin Kinhart

note.p: This finding aid is associated with a MARC collection-level record.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-04-22T09:45-0400

did.abstract: The papers of San Francisco environmental artist and activist Jo Hanson measure 4.3 linear feet and date from circa 1969 to 2009. The papers document her professional activities through biographical material, project and exhibition files, printed material, artwork, and photographs. Also found are files regarding her participation in the Women's Caucus for Art.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The papers of San Francisco environmental artist and activist Jo Hanson measure 4.3 linear feet and date from circa 1969 to 2009. The papers document her professional activities through biographical material, project and exhibition files, printed material, artwork, and photographs. Also found are files regarding her participation in the Women's Caucus for Art.

Of note within the collection is an oral history interview of Hanson, conducted by Eleanor Dickinson and Barbara Hendrickson in 2006-2007, as well was biographical documentation compiled for the interview. Hanson's installations "Crab Orchard Cemetery" and "Public Disclosure: Secrets From the Street" are also particularly well documented within this collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged as 6 series.

list.item: Series 1: Biographical Material, circa 1976-2008 (0.6 linear feet; Box 1)
Series 2: Project and Exhibition Files, circa 1973-2009 (0.8 linear feet; Box 1-2)
Series 3: Women's Caucus for Art, 1977-2006 (0.4 linear feet; Box 2)
Series 4: Printed Material, 1971-2008 (0.4 linear feet; Box 2)
Series 6: Photographs, circa 1969-2007 (1.7 linear feet; Boxes 3-5)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires and appointment. Use of archival audiovisual recordings with no duplicate access copy requires advance notice.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: The Jo Hanson papers are owned by the Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution. Literary rights as possessed by the donor have been dedicated to public use for research, study, and scholarship. The collection is subject to all copyright laws.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated in 2011 by Eleanor Dickinson, Hanson's friend.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Jo Hanson papers, circa 1969-2009. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: The collection was processed to a minimal level and a finding aid prepared by Erin Kinhart in 2014. The collection has been minimally rearranged and retains the existing/original folder titles when possible. All materials have been rehoused in archival folders and boxes for long-term stability, but often staples and other fasteners have not been removed. Materials within folders have not been rearranged.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Jo Hanson (1918-2007) was an environmental artist and activist in San Francisco, California. She was known for turning urban trash into works of art. She exhibited her work at the Corcoran Gallery of Art in Washington, D.C., Fresno Art Museum, and the Oakland Museum of California, among other places. In 1974 her installation "Crab Orchard Cemetery" toured nationally and included a mix of sculpture, printmaking, photography, and sound. During the 1980s she served on the San Francisco Arts Commission and championed the work of underrepresented women and artists of color. In 1996 she helped establish WEAD, the Women Environmental Artists Directory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found here is biographical documentation on Jo Hanson. Included are a few documents created by Hanson, including artist statements, a resume, lists, and a biographical file compiled for a possible college course. Also found are one sound cassette recording of Hanson's memorial and a video cassette interview conducted in October, 2006. The bulk of this series consists of files regarding Hanson's oral history interview which was conducted by Eleanor Dickinson and Barbara Hendrickson from December 5, 2006 to February 7, 2007. Files include draft transcripts, sound cassette recordings, project correspondence, and extensive biographical documentation used in conducting the interviews. Also found is a sound recording and transcript of Eleanor Dickinson being interviewed by Barbara Hendrickson about her friendship with Hanson.

did.unittitle: Oral History Interview Conducted by Eleanor Dickinson and Barbara Hendrickson
Eleanor Dickinson Files Regarding Jo Hanson

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Jo Hanson's project and exhibition files include correspondence, plans, photographs, printed material, and news clippings. Of note is extensive documentation on Hanson's installation work "Crab Orchard Cemetery" which toured nationally in the late 1970s, and her exhibition "Public Disclosure: Secrets From the Street" held at City Hall and the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art in 1980.

did.unittitle: "Art That's Sweeping the City," Millbrae Art and Wine Festival
"Public Disclosure: Secrets From the Street" Exhibition
"Off-Site: Artists in Response to the Environment" Exhibition
Fresno Art Museum Exhibition and Gift

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found here are Jo Hanson's files documenting her participation in the Women's Caucus for Art. Files may include caucus publications, event materials, meeting minutes, correspondence, photographs and other records. Of note are draft writings, correspondence, publications, and photographs documenting "A Day to Honor Women in the Arts" at the 1979 San Francisco Art Festival.

did.unittitle: San Francisco Art Festival, "A Day to Honor Women in the Arts"
International Dinner Party Honoring Marcelle Lebaudt
South Bay Chapter Conference on Aging

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed material consists of publications regarding various events, a few exhibition catalogs, and newsletters. The bulk of the material found here are news clippings documenting Jo Hanson's art and community activities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found here are drawings, one sketchbook, and numerous original designs and graphics by Jo Hanson intended for note cards, business cards, flyers, and other projects. Also of note are Kodaliths printed by Hanson, a handmade book titled "The Artist's Pallet," and a drawing of Hanson by friend Eleanor Dickinson.

did.unittitle: Portrait of Jo Hanson by Eleanor Dickinson
"Messages From the Street" Title Page Design
Original Graphics for Cards, Flyers, Announcements
Oversized Original Graphics from Box 3, Folders 21-22

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found here are photographs and negatives primarily documenting Hanson's artwork and related projects including "Crab Orchard Cemetery." Photographs depict cemetery gravestones, foliage, and landscapes. Also found are a few installation photographs of her artwork and one album of artwork. The few personal photographs depict Jo Hanson and Eleanor Dickinson casting a sculpture in a studio, snapshots of Hanson at various events, and Hanson's funeral.

did.unittitle: Photographs of Jo Hanson and Eleanor Dickinson Casting
Photographs of Foliage for Sawyer Show
Photographs of Muybridge on Film and Stereoscopic Images
Unidentified Photographs Taken by Jo Hanson
Photographs of Artwork by Hannah Chauvet
